comment: The syllabus was copy-pasted from another of her courses, which automatically caused problems. She would forget to upload the material for the week until Thursday, when everything was due the following Sunday, and would not give extra time. Ended up dropping because it was too difficult to follow what was due when, and I didn't want to fail.
TAKE HER!! You are only graded on 5 quizzes which you can study for on quizlet. Super easy class with a very nice professor.

Syllabus that was copy/pasted from another class with wrong dates. Dated, long, tedious documentaries that we're forced to watch. Almost never responded to student emails asking for help/clarification. Class was relatively easy to get by on your own. Don't expect it to be enjoyable or helpful though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Polite. Work isn't hard, there's just very little of it. 5 grades in total for the summer class. Very easy grades though!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Her classes are amazing! She was my favorite professor at KSU, I took several of her courses. You do have to do a lot of reading, but it's all SO interesting. Dr. Sen is a good person who actually cares about her students as well.

Grade consists of 10 discussions worth 3 points each for 30% of the grade. Another 30% was the midterm which was a media analysis discourse paper. And 40% came from the final exam which is a mini-ethnography of a ritual paper. Have to read to get good grade in discussions and other stuff which is graded harshly by TA in course. Got an A though.
She's, literally, the. Best.  If you are serious about opening your mind and exploring holistic academia, she is the one to help you do just that.

Professor Debarati does not give any tests! Grade is based off discussions (30% of grade), midterm paper (30% of grade), and final paper (40% of grade).  I wish there were more assignments or the grading scale as not so intense. You do NOT get your midterm paper grade before drop without penalty, not cool.
Best professor I have had in the four years I have been at Kennesaw. One midterm assignment a few discussions and a final assignment. I would definitely take again!

Fantastic professor! Fairly liberal and very knowledgeable - funny too! She does take attendance but not mandatory, and you should definitely do the readings because class discussion is centered around them. Easy grades...one take home midterm and a final paper - she also counts class discussion and participation. Def. take her!
